document.heading: PUEBLO DE SAN ILDEFONSO COUNCIL RESOLUTION NO. SI-R21-023
Authorizing Loan to San Ildefonso Services, LLC for the Purchase of Vigil Enterprises, Inc., a California Corporation
document.preamble: At a duly called meeting of the Council of San Ildefonso Pueblo on the 13th day of October, 2021, the following law was adopted:

recital.text: the Council established and chartered San Ildefonso Services, LLC ("SIS, LLC") under tribal law as a single member limited liability company wholly owned by the Pueblo; and,

in accordance with the Fifth Amended Articles of Organization of SIS LLC ("Articles of Organization"), the duly-appointed members of the five (5) person Member's Representative group (the "Member's Representatives") together exercise all rights of the Pueblo in its role as the single member of SIS LLC; and,

SIS LLC is a Manager-Managed limited liability company, and Peter Fant currently serves as the appointed Manager and the Manager possesses the exclusive authority to manage the business affairs of SIS LLC; and,

pursuant to Article VII of the Articles of Organization, the business purpose of SIS LLC is to engage in federal contracting and other lawful business ventures that serve the best interest of SIS LLC, the Pueblo and its members; and
in furtherance of SIS LLC's business purpose, SIS LLC intends to acquire Vigil Enterprises, Inc. ("VEI") a California Corporation, from Miller Engineers Inc., d/b/a Souder Miller & Associates; and

the Member's Representatives of SIS LLC determined it was in the best interest of SIS LLC to begin negotiations for the acquisition of VEI and to explore funding options for the purposes of further developing SIS LLC's federal contracting capabilities; and,
SIS LLC seeks funding for the acquisition of VEI from the Pueblo which terms are detailed in a proposed Loan Agreement; and,

the Council has reviewed the general terms of the proposed Loan Agreement and believes it is in the best interest of the Pueblo to authorize the Governor to negotiate and enter into a final Loan Agreement with SIS LLC for the purpose of acquiring VEI; and,
the Loan Agreement is not intended to be a capital contribution by the Member's Representatives.

para.text: Authorizes the Governor to negotiate and execute a Loan Agreement with SIS LLC for the purchase of VEI.
Authorizes up to $750,000 of Pueblo funds for the loan to be taken from available funds.
Authorizes and directs the Governor, or his designee to take such actions as deemed necessary to carry out the intent of this Act

procedural-data.text: The foregoing resolution was duly voted upon by the Council on October 13, 2021, at a meeting with a vote of 6 in favor, 2 opposed, 0 abstaining and 2 absent (Governor presiding and not voting) pursuant to the authority vested in the Council by the Agreement of the Pueblo de San Ildefonso.

text.strong: DELIVERY OF THE RESOLUTION TO THE GOVERNOR:

procedural-data.text: Resolution No. SI-R21-023 was presented to the Governor of the Pueblo de San Ildefonso on the 14th day of October, 2021, pursuant to the Governing document of the Pueblo de San Ildefonso ("Agreement"), GOVERNOR, Sec. 4(c), and will become effective after signature by the Governor or veto override by the Council.

attachment.heading: ACT AUTHORIZING LOAN TO SAN ILDEFONSO SERVICES, LLC FOR THE PURCHASE OF VIGIL ENTERPRISES, INC., A CALIFORNIA CORPORATION

section.heading: Short Title
section.text: This enactment shall be known as the "ACT AUTHORIZING LOAN TO SAN ILDEFONSO SERVICES, LLC FOR THE PURCHASE OF VIGIL ENTERPRISES, INC. A CALIFORNIA CORPORATION ("Act")."

section.heading: Purpose
section.text: The Purpose of this Act is to authorize a Loan Agreement between the Pueblo and SIS LLC for the acquisition of VEI.

section.heading: Findings
section.text: The Council hereby finds and declares that:

para.text: San Ildefonso Services, LLC ("SIS, LLC") was established and chartered by the Pueblo under tribal law as a single member limited liability company wholly owned by the Pueblo; and

In accordance with the Fifth Amended Articles of Organization of SIS, LLC ("Articles of Organization"), the duly-appointed members of the five (5) person Member's Representative group (the "Member's Representatives") together exercise all rights of the Pueblo in its role as the single member of SIS, LLC"); and

SIS LLC is a Manager-Managed limited liability company, and Peter Fant currently serves as the appointed Manager and the Manager possesses the exclusive authority to manage the business affairs of SIS LLC; and

Pursuant to Article VII of the Articles of Organization, the business purpose of SIS LLC is to engage in federal contracting and other lawful business ventures that serve the best interest of SIS LLC, the Pueblo and its members; and
In furtherance of SIS LLC's business purpose, SIS LLC intends to acquire Vigil Enterprises, Inc., ("VEI"), a California Corporation, from Miller Engineers Inc., d/b/a Souder Miller & Associates; and

The Member's Representatives of SIS LLC determined it was in the best interest of SIS LLC to begin negotiations for the acquisition of VEI and to explore funding options for the purposes of further developing SIS LLC's federal contracting capabilities; and
SIS LLC seeks partial funding for the acquisition of VEI from the Pueblo which terms are detailed in the Loan Agreement; and

The Council has reviewed the general terms of the proposed Loan Agreement and believes it is in the best interest of the Pueblo to authorize the Governor to negotiate and enter into a final Loan Agreement with SIS LLC for the purpose of acquiring VEI; and
The Loan Agreement is not intended to be a capital contribution by the Member's Representatives.
The Council hereby authorizes the Governor to negotiate and execute a Loan Agreement with SIS LLC for the purchase of VEI.
The Term of the Loan Agreement shall be for a five-year period beginning October 1, 2021 to September 30, 2026.
The Council hereby authorizes up to $750,000 of Pueblo funds for the Loan to be taken from available federal grant funds or other available funds.
The Governor, or his designee, is authorized to take such actions as deemed necessary to carry out the intent this Act
